CSSClamp.summary: The clamp() CSS function clamps a middle value within a range of values between a defined minimum bound and a maximum bound. The function takes three parameters: a minimum value, a preferred value, and a maximum allowed value.

remarks.para: Note that using clamp() for font sizes, as in these examples, allows you to set a font-size that grows with the size of the viewport, but doesn't go below a minimum font-size or above a maximum font-size. It has the same effect as the code in Fluid Typography but in one line, and without the use of media queries.

CSSClamp.returns: clamp(MIN, VAL, MAX) is resolved as {{CSSxRef("max", "max")}}(MIN, {{CSSxRef("min", "min")}}(VAL, MAX)).Based on the provided parameters, the function returns {{CSSxRef("<length>")}}, {{CSSxRef("<frequency>")}}, {{CSSxRef("<angle>")}}, {{CSSxRef("<time>")}}, {{CSSxRef("<percentage>")}}, {{CSSxRef("<number>")}}, or {{CSSxRef("<integer>")}}.
